original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammapaccanīya (2), Dukadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (6)
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma paccanīya
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Reversal of Terms🔽The Chapter on the Pairs of Terms

original: 12.1. Hetuduka, Sahetukadukādi
analyzed: hetu duka sa hetuka duka ādi
translated: The Chapter on the Pairs of Terms Beginning with Cause

original: Namo tassa Bhagavato Arahato Sammāsambuddhassa.
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: Homage to that Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One.

original: Nahetuṁ nasahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nasahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetum na sa hetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe vipāke ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With a non-cause not causally formed as condition there is a non-cause not causally formed as a condition by way of cause. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuṁ nasahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nasahetuko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetum na sa hetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: With a cause there are three. With an object there is one. … With kamma there is one. … With nutriment there is one. … With a faculty there is one. … With a path there is one. … With an attainment there is one. … With non-hindrance there are three.🔽With a non-cause not causally formed as condition there is a non-cause not causally formed as a condition by way of non-cause.

original: Nahetuṁ nasahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nasahetuko dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetum na sa hetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: With a non-cause not causally formed as condition there is a non-cause not causally formed as a condition by way of object. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… nakamme ekaṁ …pe… naāhāre naindriye najhāne namagge ekaṁ …pe… novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi pe na kamme ekam pe na āhāre na indriye na jhāne na magge ekam pe no vigate tīṇi
translated: With a non-cause there is one. With a non-object there are three. With a non-dominance there are three. … With non-kamma there is one. … With non-nutriment there are three. … With a non-faculty there is one. … With a non-path there is one. … With a non-attainment there is one. … With a non-hindrance there are three.

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: Cause and object

original: Nanahetu nasahetuko dhammo nahetussa nasahetukassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na na hetu na sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa na sa hetukassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state without root-cause is related to a state without root-cause as a condition by way of root-cause condition.

original: Nahetu nasahetuko dhammo nahetussa nasahetukassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na hetu na sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa na sa hetukassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state without root-cause is related to a state without root-cause as a condition by way of object condition.

original: Nahetu nasahetuko dhammo nanahetussa nasahetukassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu na sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ na na hetussa na sa hetukassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: A state without root-cause is related to a state with multiple root-causes as a condition by way of object condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe cattāri, anantare cattāri …pe… sahajāte tīṇi, aññamaññe ekaṁ,
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe cattāri anantare cattāri pe sahajāte tīṇi aññamaññe eka
translated: In the section on root-cause, there is one line. In the section on object, there are four lines. In the section on proximity, there are four lines. … In the section on conascence, there are three lines. In the section on mutuality, there is one line.

original: nissaye upanissaye cattāri, purejāte pacchājāte āsevane dve, kamme …pe… jhāne ekaṁ,
analyzed: nissaye upanissaye cattāri purejāte pacchājāte āsevane dve kamme pe jhāne eka
translated: In the section on support, in the section on decisive support, there are four lines. In the section on prenascence, in the section on postnascence, in the section on repetition, there are two lines. In the section on kamma, … In the section on jhāna, there is one line.

original: sampayutte ekaṁ, vippayutte tīṇi …pe… avigate cattāri.
analyzed: sampayutte eka vippayutte tīṇi pe avigate cattāri
translated: In the section on association, there is one line. In the section on dissociation, there are three lines. … In the section on absence, there are four lines.

original: Nahetuṁ naahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu naahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Nahetuṁ naahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nanahetu naahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na hetum na ahetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na ahetukaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā 🔽na hetum na ahetukam dhammam paṭicca na na hetu na ahetukaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A state without root-cause is related to a state without root-cause as a condition by way of root-cause condition.🔽A state without root-cause is related to a state with multiple root-causes as a condition by way of root-cause condition.

original: Nahetuṁ naahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu naahetuko ca nanahetu naahetuko ca dhammā
analyzed: na hetum na ahetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na ahetukaḥ ca na na hetu na ahetukaḥ ca dhammā
translated: With a non-cause that is not related to a non-cause as condition, a non-cause that is not related to a non-cause and a cause that is not related to a non-cause

original: uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Nanahetuṁ naahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nanahetu naahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: uppajjanti hetu paccayā  nana hetum na ahetukam dhammam paṭicca nana hetu na ahetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: are produced. This is the condition being by way of cause.🔽With a cause that is not related to a non-cause as condition, a cause that is not related to a non-cause is produced. This is the condition being by way of cause.

original: Nanahetuṁ naahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu naahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na na hetum na ahetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na ahetukaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a cause that is not related to a non-cause as condition, a non-cause that is not related to a non-cause is produced. This is the condition being by way of cause.

original: Nanahetuṁ naahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu naahetuko ca nanahetu naahetuko ca dhammā
analyzed: na na hetum na ahetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na ahetukaḥ ca na na hetu na ahetukaḥ ca dhammā
translated: With a cause that is not related to a non-cause as condition, a non-cause that is not related to a non-cause and a cause that is not related to a non-cause

original: uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: are produced. This is the condition being by way of cause.

original: Nahetuṁ naahetukañca nanahetuṁ naahetukañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu naahetuko dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nahetuṁ naahetukañca nanahetuṁ naahetukañca dhammaṁ paṭicca
analyzed: na hetum na ahetukam ca na na hetum na ahetukañca dhammam paṭicca na hetu na ahetukaḥ dhammaḥ  uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetum na ahetukam ca na na hetum na ahetukam ca dhammam paṭicca
translated: With a non-cause that is not related to a non-cause and a cause that is not related to a non-cause as condition, a non-cause that is not related to a non-cause🔽is produced. This is the condition being by way of cause. With a non-cause that is not related to a non-cause and a cause that is not related to a non-cause as condition,

original: nanahetu naahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nahetuṁ naahetukañca nanahetuṁ naahetukañca
analyzed: na na hetu na ahetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetum na ahetukam ca na na hetum na ahetukam ca
translated: a cause that is not related to a non-cause is produced. This is the condition being by way of cause. With a non-cause that is not related to a non-cause and a cause that is not related to a non-cause as condition,

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu naahetuko ca nanahetu naahetuko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na hetu na ahetuko ca na na hetu na ahetuko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With dhamma as condition: a non-cause that is not related to a cause and a cause that is not related to a cause arise. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… avigate nava. (Sabbattha nava.)🔽Nahetuṁ nahetusampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nahetusampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe avigate nava sabbattha nava  na hetum na hetu sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na hetu sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: (In the section on cause, there are nine.)🔽With a non-cause that is not related to a cause as condition: a non-cause that is not related to a cause arises. (In brief.)🔽(In the section on cause, there are three.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe vipāke ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With a non-cause that is not related to a cause as condition: a non-cause that is not related to a cause arises. (In brief.)🔽With a cause that is not related to a cause as condition: a cause that is not related to a cause arises. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuṁ nahetuvippayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nahetuvippayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nanahetuṁ nahetuvippayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nanahetu nahetuvippayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetum na hetu vippayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na hetu vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi 🔽na na hetum na hetu vippayuttam dhammam paṭicca na na hetu na hetu vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: (In the section on cause, there are three.)

original: Nahetuṁ nahetuvippayuttañca nanahetuṁ nahetuvippayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nahetuvippayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā nava …pe… avigate nava. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)🔽Nahetuṁ nahetuñceva naahetukañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nahetu ceva naahetuko ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Yāva pañhāvārepi ekaṁ.)🔽Nanahetuṁ naahetukañceva nana ca hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nanahetu naahetuko ceva nana ca hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetum na hetu vippayuttam ca na na hetum na hetu vippayuttam ca dhammam paṭicca na hetu na hetu vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  hetuyā nava pe avigate nava sabbattha vitthāro  na hetum na hetum ca iva na ahetukañca dhammam paṭicca na hetu na hetu ca iva na ahetukaḥ ca dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā yāva pañhā vāre pi eka  nana hetum na ahetukam ca iva na na ca hetum dhammam paṭicca nana hetu na ahetukaḥ ca iva na na ca hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā sabbattha eka
translated: With an object that is not a root and is not associated with a root, there is a single root and a single root-cause condition. (The rest are condensed.)🔽With a root, there are nine … with an indeterminate, there are nine. (In all cases, the explanation is in detail.)🔽With an object that is not a root and is not a root-cause, there is a single root and a single root-cause condition. (In all cases, the explanation is in detail.)🔽With an object that is a root-cause and is not a root, there is a single root and a single root-cause condition. (In all cases, the explanation is in detail.)

original: Nahetuṁ nahetuñceva nahetuvippayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nahetu ceva nahetuvippayutto ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetum na hetum ca iva na hetu vippayuttañca dhammam paṭicca na hetu na hetu ca iva na hetu vippayuttaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā sabbattha eka
translated: With an object that is not a root and is not associated with a root, there is a single root and a single root-dissociate state. With a root and a root-dissociate state, there is a single root and a single root-dissociate state. With a root and a root-dissociate state, there is a single root and a single root-

original: Nanahetuṁ nahetuvippayuttañceva nana ca hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nanahetu nahetuvippayutto ceva nana ca hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽Nahetuṁ nasahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nasahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: nana hetum na hetu vippayuttam ca iva na na ca hetum dhammam paṭicca nana hetu na hetu vippayuttaḥ ca iva na na ca hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā sabbattha eka  na hetum na sa hetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā sabbattha eka
translated: Dependent on a condition that is a root-cause and is not dissociated from a root-cause, and also dependent on a condition that is a root-cause and is a root-cause, there arises a condition that is a root-cause and is not dissociated from a root-cause. (In each triad one case.)🔽Dependent on a condition that is not a root-cause and is not associated with a root-cause, there arises a condition that is not a root-cause and is not associated with a root-cause. (In each triad one case.)

original: Nahetuṁ naahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu naahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetum na ahetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na ahetukaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā sabbattha eka
translated: Dependent on a condition that is not a root-cause and is not dissociated from a root-cause, there arises a condition that is not a root-cause and is not dissociated from a root-cause. (In each triad one case.)
